job description:
Position Title: Quality Assurance Scientist

Position Overview:

This is a highly technical quality position responsible for decision-making on product issues, design and development requiring critical analytical thinking. The desired candidate has a strong scientific background, knowledge of quality processes, attention to detail and strong organizational and communication skills.

Roles and Responsibilities:
  • Responsible for Technical Decision-Making for Product Issues
  • Performs detailed data review.
  • Participates and reviews in risk assessment for products and processes.
  • Supports risk analysis process for technical accuracy for various QMS, e.g., non-conformances, investigations, CAPAs, etc.
  • Represents Quality in Design and Development including process changes.
  • Provides key technical guidance and oversight to Design and Development process including design change control.
  • Evaluates changes orders
  • Provides technical guidance and quality assurance support in the transfer of new products and process to maintain quality standards.
  • Evaluates and edits Technical Protocols and Reports
  • Performs critical review of documentation for qualification, verification, and validation activities.
  • Provides guidance on gaps identified from the review and actively participates to determine potential remediation activities.
  • Assures design and development, and manufacturing operations are performed in compliance with QMS as well as domestic and international regulations.
  • Provides scientific approach and Quality Assurance direction to the approval of the QMS documents such as batch records, protocols, procedures, qualification, and validation reports.
  • Enforces critical analytical thinking in the investigation management process specifically during root cause analysis, risk assessment evaluation and corrective and preventive actions determination to guarantee that gaps are properly addressed.
  • Provides scientific input into investigations using a systematic approach for the opportunities identified to ensure root cause and CAPAs are aligned.
  • Assists management during internal and regulatory agencies inspections.
  • Performs trend analysis to provide recommendations to improve the process and/or product quality.
  • Supports the Annual Product Review elements for Quality events of manufacturing.
  • Participates as quality representative or liaison in site projects.
Qualifications:
  • Master Degree in Science (Chemical, Biology or Microbiology) with five (5) years of experience in Quality Assurance responsibilities in a medical device or equivalent regulated industry
  • Strong knowledge of relevant GMP, FDA, EU regulations and the ability to interpret and apply them for intended use.
  • Self-motivated and team work oriented.
  • Technical and scientific capability to make firm decisions and recommendations.
  • Excellent interpersonal skills and the ability to interact with people at all levels.
  • Effective communication Skills.
  • Sense of urgency and analytical thinking.
  • Proficient knowledge of computer systems (Microsoft Office etc.) and applications like PLM, QMS and ERP.
  • Solid ability for analyzing data and detecting deviations, trends, and inconsistencies.
  • Proficient knowledge of problem solving and root cause analysis methodologies (e.g. Kepner Tregoe).
  • Technical Writing experience, a plus.
